title.rendered: “Crushing Terrorism: Inside IDF’s 10-Hour Anti-Terror Operation, Arrests, and Confiscations Across Judea and Samaria”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

The IDF, together with the SHABAK and the Border Police, conducted an anti-terrorist operation in a small village for nearly 10 hours under the command of the Binyamin Brigade. The forces confiscated a great deal of weaponry across the Judea and Samaria region, as well as equipment in a printing house for propaganda materials in Nablus, which belongs to the Hamas terrorist organization.

In an operation that lasted about 10 hours to thwart terror in a small village under the command of the Binyamin brigade, reserve IDF soldiers and the Border police questioned dozens of suspects, arrested two wanted individuals, and confiscated war materials and military equipment.

Undercover Border Police agents and other Border Police forces operated last night in the village of Bala’a, part of the Menashe Brigade and arrested a wanted individual, confiscating war materials, terror funds, and a significant number of explosive bottles. During the operation, our forces fired at terrorists who threw explosives at them, hits were reported.

In the city of Nablus, in the Samaria Brigade, equipment was confiscated from a printing house that prints propaganda material for the Hamas terror organization. In the villages of Dura and Hermala, additional warfare means and terror funds were found.

The three detainees have been transferred for further investigation by the security forces. There were no injuries to our forces.

So far, since the beginning of the war, approximately 2,600 wanted individuals have been arrested throughout the Judea and Samaria Brigade and the Rift Valley and Valleys Brigade, of which approximately 1,300 are affiliated with the Hamas terror organization.

Attached are pictures of the located warfare equipment: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC06012024IUBVIRUBV
